news.title: Two dead and several injured in multi-vehicle crash involving bus and lorry in Co Meath
news.summary: Two people have died following a serious multi-vehicle crash in Co Meath this morning.

news.title: ‘They thought they were gods. Untouchable’ – killer Ruth Lawrence planned to flee to Peru with boyfriend while on the run in South Africa
news.summary: Double murderer Ruth Lawrence was investigated over a hostage incident while on the run from gardaí in which two people were held against their will and terrorised.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Allowing Simon Harris to appoint himself to Finance is a symptom of Micheál Martin’s weakness
news.summary: The leader’s loyalists are blaming the dissidents for stirring the pot on Micheál Martin. “A small number of people are out to destroy Fianna Fáil,” a senior party figure reportedly told a behind-closed-doors local meeting.

news.title: Report on alleged cheating in electrician apprenticeship exams referred to gardaí
news.summary: A report into alleged cheating in electrical apprenticeship exams has been referred to the gardaí by Quality and ­Qualifications Ireland (QQI), the  Irish Independent  can reveal.

news.title: Ireland rugby jury: Rating the Autumn performances, Andy Farrell’s biggest issues, and the Six Nations bolters
news.summary: Our rugby jury debate Ireland’s performances in the Autumn Nations series and Andy Farrell’s biggest issues ahead of the 2026 Six Nations, among other hot topics.

news.title: The designer and Diana: Paul Costelloe’s enduring friendship with ‘rather lonely’ princess
news.summary: It was inevitable that Diana, Princess of Wales would crop up in the conversation.

news.title: ‘Back to the belly of the beast’ – Kneecap announce biggest headline show to date
news.summary: Kneecap are set to hit the stage in London next summer for their biggest headline show to date.

news.title: Home-heating oil prices shoot up just as cold snap hits the country
news.summary: The cost of home-heating oil has spiked just as the country is being hit by a cold snap.

news.title: ‘It was a racket. But it was a racket RTÉ started.’ Myles Dungan on freelance contracts, losing ‘Late Date’ and moving into fiction writing
news.summary: For the most part, Myles ­Dungan is reliably sardonic and self-deprecating. The writing of his excellent new novel,  The Red Branch , a historical espionage thriller about ­“Fenians who are at it again” in 19th-century San Francisco, sprung from “the joy of making shit up”.

news.title: Dear Vicki: ‘Can I insist my staff dress appropriately when they have a meeting with clients?’
news.summary: Dress expectations seem to have changed radically since the lockdown, in particular. Even at the most high-level meetings, you don't see men wear suits and ties anymore.
